info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 4:01AM MST until January 07 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches for valleys. Marias Pass and the higher terrain could see 2 to 3 feet of snow. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph over Marias Pass Tuesday causing blowing and drifting snow. An arctic front passage later Wednesday will cause a rapid temperatures drop and gusty northeast winds. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Marias Pass, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Polebridge, and Essex. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 2 PM MST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Tuesday through Wednesday. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. Travel could be affected. Bitter cold temperatures and dangerous wind chills will follow the frontal passage on Wednesday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
